info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:31PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong cold front will continue to impact portions of North Central and Central Montana through at least 515 PM MDT... At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cold front along a line extending from 29 miles north of Beaver Creek to 10 miles southeast of Fort Benton to 8 miles south of Great Falls to 16 miles west of Cascade to 22 miles south of Heart Butte. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, brief heavy rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Smoke behind the cold front may reduce visibility to one mile or less. Scattered thunderstorms have also developed along and behind this front, while gusty northerly winds behind the front have brought wildfire smoke in from Canada. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Havre, Choteau, Fort Benton, Cascade, Big Sandy, Fairfield, Belt, Geraldine, Parker School, Joplin, Highwood, East Glacier Park Village, Azure, Inverness, Black Eagle, Geyser, Fort Shaw, Beaver Creek and Fort Shaw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
